name: jQuery Bookmarklet Plugin
tagline: Create a bookmarklet from JS file or Gist
body: ### What is a bookmarklet? According to Wikipedia, a [bookmarklet](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bookmarklet) is a bookmark stored in a web browser that contains JavaScript commands to extend the browser's functionality. Usually bookmarklets are created when the user drags and drops a special anchor (``) element into their bookmarks toolbar. The anchor's `href` attribute is set to `javascript:`. ### How does this plugin help? Bookmarklets are kind of irritating to maintain, since you have to prepare URL-encoded JavaScript and add it to your `` element every time you update the script. This jQuery plugin loads your bookmarklet's JavaScript from an external file, and then augments an anchor element on your page with the appropriate url. It can also load JavaScript from a Gist via the GitHub API. ### Usage 1. Include jQuery: ```html ``` 2. Include plugin's code: ```html ``` 3. Add an anchor to your HTML: ```html My Bookmarklet ``` 4. Call the plugin: ```javascript $("#element").bookmarklet({ raw: "path/to/your/script.js" }); ``` Alternatively, point the plugin at a Gist: ```javascript $("#element").bookmarklet({ gist_id: "MY_GIST_ID", gist_filename: "filename.js" /* gist_filename is optional if the Gist contains one file */ }); ``` You can get your Gist's id from its url: `https://gist.github.com//`.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
